instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2485: What is A2485? A2485 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3651, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02100, 820-02382..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not recognized
threads.message: Battery sign shows X and fans spinning high. Apple HWT result says "might be something wrong with charger" but I do have an orange light and shows charge sign before login to user account. Looks like no data communication is happening, do these have SMC chip or does the battery talk to the T2 chip? I have tried a new battery, same result. Any tips? Will remove the board and check for issues.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not recognized
threads.message:
SMC functions are embedded into M1 CPU.

Check <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> voltage.
May have problems with <CHIP>U5150</CHIP>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q5150</TRANSISTOR>.
Also check diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2485</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not recognized
threads.message: I found the issue, some liquid near cPU on SDA lines, pulled a wire and working thanks!
